fields.name: Argentia Jersey
fields.description: This kit strikes to the core. National identity, pride – the sky blue and white stripes are all about tradition and keep the nation of Argentina at the center of their design. This is iconic simplicity by adidas, this is elegant black detailing – like the back of the jersey, which is meant to capture the look of the stripes when a fan drapes the flag over their shoulders and walks proudly towards the next matchday. Join that march and represent Argentina in this new home top.

fields.name: Belguim Jersey
fields.description: It’s Red Devils time. This one needs no explanation, no classification or justification. Belgium will bring the heat on the world stage this year and you can show just how hot your passion burns with one of the fieriest jersey design takes we’ve ever seen.

fields.name: Brazil Jersey
fields.description: With the new Brazil 22/23 Home jersey, Nike invites you to Veste A Garra, or Wear the Claw. And the symbolism is evident as the Onca Knit (spotted knit) resembles that of Brazil’s national animal, the jaguar. The spots are weighted – darker in the locations that players sweat the most, and lighter elsewhere. But Veste a Garra is two-fold; the double-entendre of Garra being that the Brazilian slang term can also mean resilient, gritty and tough. In this new home shirt, Nike hopes to embody and embolden all of Brazil with those qualities as they face this winter’s trials on the world’s biggest stage.

fields.name: Cameron Jersey
fields.description: Cameroon finally drop their 22/23 tops, featuring a strong – no, indomitable – chest graphic for this locally-based group of players looking to make waves on the international stage this year. Join the lions, represent one of Africa’s proudest footballing nations.

fields.name: Canada Jersey
fields.description: A red home, a white away, and a black third jersey make up the 2022 range for Canada – the new champions of CONCACAF. These kits are already iconic and historic, as the lads from up north have qualified for their first FIFA World Cup™ since 1986. Be a part of that history and celebrate the Canadian triumph with this 2022 Canada jersey from Nike.

fields.name: Costa Rica Jersey
fields.description: New Balance outfits Costa Rica with a clean refresh ahead of their performances on the world stage this winter. Simple, bold presentation with accented sleeve cuffs leave the sparkly new federation crest shining its brightest.

fields.name: Croatia Jersey
fields.description: When the Croatian football federation asks, you deliver. Croatia players, fans and residents alike all yearned for a return to a stronger, more white home jersey for their beloved nation. Nike delivered, with more blank space for the jersey to breathe, surrounded by smaller, more understated checkers. The differing scales allow for a central chest location of the Nike swoosh and federation crest. While still maintaining bits of what made their previous Croatia kits so good, Nike have created something entirely new – and entirely memorable – here on the Croatia 22/23 home jersey.

fields.name: Denmark Jersey
fields.description: “We don’t wish to be visible during a tournament that has cost thousands of people their lives.” And so, in response to the human rights violations and migrant worker mistreatment that took place in Qatar during the buildup to this winter’s tournament, Hummel and Denmark loudly proclaim their silence. The fully muted kit will display Denmark’s colors with monochromed federation crest and brand logos. This time, Denmark do not wish to stand out amongst the crowd.

fields.name: Ecuador Jersey
fields.description: It’s the little touches that go the longest way for Ecuador and their jersey supplier, Marathon. Under the inner hem, you’ll find ‘Ecuador’ written in six different languages, while on the back neck lies the country’s silhouette. On the reverse side of the federation crest, inside the kit, lies a bespoke Ecuadorian design. Lastly, on the sleeve cuffs you’ll find minor flag detailing – it’s all a subtle work of art for Ecuador that surrounds yellow base jersey with light linear patterns gracing the abdomen.

fields.name: England Jersey
fields.description: Raglan sleeves are shaded in gradient blue hues on the new 22/23 England home jersey by Nike. The “Blue Fury” and “Blue Void” colors feature smaller graphic prints on the inside of them, but they’re not footprints, they’re claw marks. The Three Lions roar into action on the world stage this year with one of the strongest teams they’ve ever fielded. With a white base and blue trimming on the sleeves, this is the kit they’ll announce themselves to the world in.

fields.name: France Jersey
fields.description: Family – the 2019 France team featuresd a unified squad of players with a heritage from 20 different countries. Royalty – soccer royalty and most recent FIFA World Cup™ champions. Power – one of the strongest national teams in the world. These are the qualities Nike looks to embody on the understated France 22/23 Home jersey. These qualities come from the jersey’s design inspiration and sleeve cuff graphic – a Toile print of the Chene Chappelle. Toile, the French fabric design, twists the leaves of the Chene Chappelle, a ~1,000 year-old tree-turned-chapel in Normandy. The ancient Oak tree is known to represent – yes, you guessed it – Family, Royalty and Power.

fields.name: Germany Jersey
fields.description: For Germany in 22/23, speed is the name of the game. Gnabry, Gosens, Sane and Werner will be right at home in this kit, then. The racing-stripe inspired 22/23 Germany Home Jersey comes outfitted with royal golden accents and centered logo application. On the inside neck, a sign off reading ‘die mannschaft’ with four stars printed above. On the outside, pure class, and the best the Germans have looked in years.

fields.name: Ghana Jersey
fields.description: When it means more than a game, it needs more than a jersey. Football meets folklore in the 2022 PUMA National Federations Away kits. Their bold design language reinterprets national motifs from football, culture, and nature, bringing them together in ways that turn each jersey into a statement for both the nation and the national team. Made with high-performance ULTRAWEAVE fabric from PUMA, these jerseys are larger than football and lighter than ever.

fields.name: Iran Jersey
fields.description: Iran and Majid have – at the 11th hour – released a new pair of simple, understated looks for their country to take on the world and Group B in the this year’s FIFA World Cup™. The kits maintain their jaguar print on the sleeves, but the jaguar head design on the chest is left clean and plain allowing white on the home and red on the away to take center stage. If the release of these kits is any indication of how Iran expects to play at the tournament, then expect some late winners in Qatar.

fields.name: Japan Jersey
fields.description: Adidas and Japan bring a legend to life. This origami crane-inspired home shirt design comes as a blessing – a wish for good luck and eternal happiness, just like the person fated to find 1000 origami cranes. In Japanese folklore, the person who makes this discovery is granted a wish, as the crane is a spiritual and mythological icon in the land of the rising sun. With Japanese flag on the inside neck sign off and a legendary bespoke design, Japan will be in good hands this year.

fields.name: Mexico Jersey
fields.description: Adidas once again dip into ancient Aztec culture and heritage of the Mexico region to draw colorful and truly inspired design direction for the Mexican National Team. On the 22/23 Home Jersey, they’re finally back to their traditional green colorway, along with an aesthetically vibrant design inspired by the penacho (or copilli) of the ancient Aztec deity known as Quetzacoatl. The serpent-like god of the sun and wind, air, and learning, is often depicted with an array of feathers sprouting out from the rear of his head and back of his neck. The feathers line up in a way that’s much the same as what you see on the jersey above and lead all the way back to the wearer’s head. With this design, adidas achieves iconic simplicity as they recode the MNT legacy and provide the players and fans alike with an ancient spiritual strength.

fields.name: Morocco Jersey
fields.description: Nineteen ninety now. Inspired by the Morocco and PUMA classic, the new Morocco Home jersey honors the Atlas Lions class of 1998. The centrally aligned PUMA One logo complements the retro theme, while the federation emblem on the left shows your true support.

fields.name: Netherlands Jersey
fields.description: The ruffles and tonal oranges flowing down the Netherlands 22/23 home jersey by Nike are representative of the nation and federations main representative – the lion. A lion mane design encapsulates an unreserved group of players not shy to express themselves and show their strength. Show yours and support your country this winter and beyond.

fields.name: Poland Jersey
fields.description: The design of the 2022 football kits allows each nation’s unique heritage to be showcased through stunning design details. For Poland’s away kit, intricate sleeve graphics depict the nest and feathers of a white eagle, the feature of the country’s coat of arms, paying homage to the centuries-old symbol of Polish sovereignty and unity. Sport Red and White, Poland’s national colors, celebrate peace and honor.

fields.name: Portugal Jersey
fields.description: After a massive victory, club or country, players jog the pitch with their families and teammates, each wrapped in the home flag of their respective country. The new Portugal 22/23 home jersey mimics those moments, using the diagonal angle to replicate the hanging flags of victors, of champions. Wear yours when Portugal chase these moments this winter and beyond.

fields.name: Qatar Jersey
fields.description: A unique, Qatar-focused, FIFA branded training jersey bursting at the seams with style, flair and national pride. Represent your nation this winter and shout your loudest from the pub, the couch or the stands in this stylized, nationality-inspired design from the country of your choice.

fields.name: Saudi Arabia Jersey
fields.description: The green and white colorways of the 2022 Saudi kits are inspired by the Saudi Arabian flag. The shield of the Saudi Arabian Football Federation (SAFF) features a falcon, or saqr in Arabic which doubles as a multilingual reference to the word soccer. The away kit uses an all-over-print interpretation that builds on concepts from the 2018 and 2020 away kits to evoke a sense of speed and boldness.

fields.name: Senegal Jersey
fields.description: Senegal get their groove (back) on. When hundreds of millions tuned in for the opening match of the 2002 world championship, they witnessed an iconic moment in football history. Senegal took the lead over the reigning champions, and the team’s celebratory dance routine became part of football folklore. The Lions won, then went on to reach the quarter-final in their heroic first run at the tournament. Twenty years on, the new Home kit celebrates national legends with a retro design inspired by their era.

fields.name: Serbia Jersey
fields.description: Fly your colors high. Honoring the 2015 U-20 Champions of the World, the new Serbia jersey features a retro-inspired design with golden accents to celebrate the historic triumph.

fields.name: South Korea Jersey
fields.description: A country with energy, whose bright cultural standouts have influenced the media and interest internationally, Korea receives an energetic representation of Hallyu – the wave of Korean pop culture influence – and large helping of Dokkaebi, a goblin or devil-like creature from Korean folklore. Korea's new home jersey for 22/23 features aspects of devils, tigers and the Taegeuk design from the Korean flag. The Hallyu wave design on the sleeves and a clever devil’s tail detail emanating from the kit’s side tape bring a strong presence to center stage as Korea take to the world stage this winter.

fields.name: Spain Jersey
fields.description: Inspired by the kits of ’98 and ’02, this Spain outfit by adidas aims for iconic simplicity. With one classic kit as their symbol, Spain unites to conquer on the world stage this year – and with adidas branding on the shoulders of the kit for the firs time in 18 years, they’re ready to make their mark.

fields.name: Switzerland Jersey
fields.description: Suisse bring back a classic. Reimagined for a new era, this retro look honors the generation of players that brought Switzerland back to the biggest stages in world football during the mid-nineties. Now, they remain on those world stages year after year – and after their run in Euro 2020, one can only wonder what’s around the corner for the Swiss this year.

fields.name: Tunisia Jersey
fields.description: Tunisia step on to the world stage this winter for the 6th time – this time geared for war. With a bespoke design inspired by one of the greatest military commanders in world history, this nation will look to upset a strong group in the FIFA World Cup™. The tonal graphic design on the torso of the 22/23 Tunisia jersey is based on that of a Hannibal-worn chest piece discovered in Tunisia. The Carthaginian general and statesman is an emblematic figure in the history of the Mediterranean region around Tunisia, having clashed with Roman Republic in the Second Punic War. With this kit – yes, it’s all a bit dramatic – Tunisia summon the strength and tenacity of bygone militaries as they march into battle in Qatar and beyond.

fields.name: Uruguay Jersey
fields.description: PUMA gets Uruguay set for a highly competitive Copa America summer tournament with a fresh new home jersey design, featuring a crisp sky blue and a striped pattern underneath the arm. ¡Uruguay nomá!

fields.name: USA Jersey
fields.description: Nike took Rose Lavelle’s words to heart and used them to inspire their 22/23 away jersey. “The away is the bold trendsetter. A reason to do something different.” And so, Nike tried something a little different. This is the Ice Dye kit – the design has been recreated from an authentic ice dye with bright blue, dark obsidian and red and white dyes. Playfully youthful, but bold in the way it challenges traditional jersey design – this kit is meant to embody those qualities of both the USMNT & USWNT.

fields.name: Wales Jersey
fields.description: A massive moment for Wales, culminating in a brilliant home top made by adidas. It’s bold red, its got white accents and classic adidas three stripes on the shoulders. With a touch of texture, it’s got just enough to mix things up. And mix things up they will on the world stage this winter. They’ll remember this kit forever, no matter what happens in Group B.

fields.name: Wales World Cup Jersey
fields.description: A massive moment for Wales, culminating in a brilliant home top made by adidas. It’s bold red, its got white accents and classic adidas three stripes on the shoulders. With a touch of texture, it’s got just enough to mix things up. And mix things up they will on the world stage this winter. They’ll remember this kit forever, no matter what happens in Group B.
